This is by far the most addictive multi-player, "Asymetrical," video game I have played on the market. The collaborations and introductions of new killers/survivors while adding new abilities/perks makes the game even more exciting. You have both your favorite iconic heroes as well as familiar horror villains 1 v 4 balanced gaming. This one is well worth a try.

This game is amazing character design wise and I love it so much for that purpose. Like many online games, the community can get toxic and not work as a team and have hackers present, but I still enjoy playing it. As the team of people creating this game continue to better it as time goes on, we are getting more wonderful content. I like seeing their creativity in original characters, and I really like the lore behind this game. I mainly got so into it because someone close to me plays and I wanted to get better to spend more time with them.

Simplemente no te molestes en comprar este juego. 
La premisa es absurda y aburrida, la única forma de "ganar" es utilizar meta perks todo el tiempo haciendo el gameplay súper repetitivo. 

Como superviviente es siempre encontrar un pallet y stunear al killer toda la partida. 
Como killer es siempre comerte pallets e intentar hacer mindgames que los supervivientes se confundan cosa que es prácticamente imposible porque todos los buenos survis se saben las tácticas

Pero sin duda lo peor de todo es BHVR, una compañía sin sentido que no se ocupa de mantener el juego justo y divertido, el 90% del equipo de la empresa esta seguramente enfocado a conseguir nuevas licencias para killers y así atraer nuevas audiencias que eventualmente se dan cuenta del triste truco que BHVR hace. 

El otro 10% o menos se dedica a "balancear el juego" lo cual es simplemente introducir perks o personajes rotos para luego nerfearlos porque ni se molestan en hacer buenos tests antes de lanzarlos al publico

Por ultimo quisiera hacer una mención honorifica a VHS, un juego del mismo tipo que pronto saldrá en Steam y gratis al cual le tengo mucha esperanza ya que el mismísimo Dev tiene mas de 1000 horas jugadas en su propio juego junto con su equipo que realmente están poniendo empeño en el juego para que triunfe. 

CONCLUSIÓN: no lo compren, yo tengo +200 horas y odie 3/4 del total. No me imagino las personas con mas de 1k de horas que llegaron a la misma conclusión que yo.

Haven't enjoyed a game this much in a long time. Took me forever to actually try Dead by Daylight and I was very hesitant to give it a go, but I have not been disappointed. This game will have your heart racing for your first 50 or so hours. Like most online multiplayer games, playing with a full team of friends is best. It makes the game even more enjoyable and gives you the advantage of communication. However, if you don't have friends to play with I would recommend trying killer (in my opinion killer is more fun than survivor anyway). There are plenty of killers and survivors to choose from with different perks and playstyles that come with countless hours of fun. If you haven't tried Dead by Daylight I would 10/10 recommend giving it a go!!

DBD is a good 1v4 killer vs survivor game. The main goal for survivors is to fix gens and open the door and escape and the killers goal is to kill all and win. Both killer and survivor have perks and the perks can be the deciding point of the game. The amount of original characters and licence killers are decent same with survivors but they all have their own unique set of perks and you have to level them up to get their perk to be on others blood web. The character you play as for survivor means nothing if you have all the perks but for the killers it means a lot. All the killers have their own unique set of abilities and they all have their special add ons that can change how they play by a huge amount. For DBD I would give it a 8/10 the music, characters, and maps are nice but there are some toxic players that will face camp and tunnel but not every match but it is still an issue that I run into but there are many fun matches that I go into. But there are the rifts as well that give out tons of bloodpoints for playing the game and doing special objectives if you are new and want to level up quick.

Can I appeal my penalty?

No, we do not offer appeals for disconnection penalties.

What counts as a disconnect?

Anything that results in you leaving the match will count as a disconnect. This includes but is not limited to: Turning off your PC/console, disconnecting your Internet, closing the game, or leaving a match through the leave match button. This is crucial to ensure that the system cannot be exploited.<<<< NEWS FLASH @DEAD BY DAYLIGHT ITS A GAME NOT REAL LIFE

Refreshing competitive/strategy/horror game! 

As a survivor, you can create your own builds with unlockable perks. There are builds for distracting the killer, healing builds, stealth builds, speed builds, troll builds, tank builds, stun builds. It is a blast figuring out which build works for which killer or situation. There is a learning curve though, which makes it that much more satisfying when your strategy for escape does works out. 

Each killer comes with it's own gameplay mechanics, which adds a welcome layer of complexity for both killer and survivors.

They are still constantly updating the game's visuals and adding in new characters and maps. 400 hours in and I'm still learning new perk combinations and tricks to outplay my opponent.

Very glad I bought this game.

As someone who has played this game a ton on PS4 and now has a gaming computer to play it on PC, I do enjoy this game. I'm more of a survivor main then a killer and when I play killer, it's not seriously. 

This game is special. It's the first of its kind, the father of many who try to follow in it's footsteps. It has a little something for everyone. Like being chased in a spooky world, check. Like creative killers with fun powers, check. Like facing off or being one of the many horror movie and game icons, check. Like challenges with xp rewards, check. Like backstories for both the killers and survivors, check!

It's not a perfect game. There are bugs that take some time to patch and sometimes you will run into hackers that will hold the game hostage (tho there are fun hackers who just entertain you). And the recently changed the old ranking system to a new MRR one that didn't fix any of the match making problems, the only good thing about it is now when your rank resets, you get xp based on your rank. And while cross-platform playing is great for short wait times, there is server troubles and no post game chat for anyone besides PC.

The ONE BIG PROBLEM I really dislike about this game is you basically have to pick a platform. You can't share your account from console to PC or vis versa. All that money I put into expansions and outfits from PS4 ARE JUST FOR PS4, along with the hours of gameplay to level up characters. That's a really big grind! I almost have all the expansions for PC now, but trying to play and get all the season challenges (the archives) for both platforms is a big time dump.
I DON'T MIND buying the expansions for both platforms, it supports the developers as they worked hard on making this content, I just wish there was a way to link my accounts so they can have a shared progress and that I don't have to grind or buy outfits that I already put the time or money into getting. 

So if you want this game, PICK YOUR FAVOURITE PLATFORM! I couldn't play this on my old gaming laptop (I learned that after buying and trying) which is why I played it on PS4. Now that I have all those hours on the PS4, it's hard to grind on my new gaming PC. So pick wisely~!

Este juego me salvó la vida.

Yo tengo 27.

Mi ex esposa y yo tenemos una hija juntos y adoptamos a nuestro hijo juntos. Ahora ambos tienen 4 años.

Cuando atravesamos nuestra separación, me sentí perdido y miserable. Yo era autodestructivo. Un día me enojé tanto por todo lo que estaba fuera de mi control que golpeé un poco de concreto en un momento de emoción abrumadora. Eso hizo que me rompiera mi quinto metacarpiano en mi mano derecha ... mi mano que trabaja ... mi mano de juegos ... la mano que sostuve y con la que llevé a mis hijos a la cama ... La mano que necesitaba desesperadamente para asegurarme de poder continuar proporcionando.

Después de enterarme de la gravedad de mi daño autoinfligido, estaba al borde del suicidio. Tenga en cuenta que solo unos meses antes de esto, era el hombre más feliz sin antecedentes de depresión o ansiedad. Nunca he tenido ataques de rabia, ni he sido de los que se derrumban y lloran, pero estaba en un punto bajo que realmente me enterró de poder ver la luz del otro lado.

No teniendo nada mejor que hacer, busqué un juego que pudiera jugar, CON UNA MANO mientras me recuperaba. De alguna manera me topé con este juego y leí algunas de las críticas. Decidí que tenía que valer la pena intentarlo ... Debo admitir que no gané el juego, ni jugué tanto como algunos de ustedes. De hecho, es posible que solo haya jugado este juego uno o dos días. Dicho esto, después de hacerlo, tuve una nueva alegría y esperanza de vida. Pude dejar atrás el dolor y el sufrimiento que se había apoderado de mí. Pude experimentar la alegría y la felicidad de otras personas. Pude ver los frutos de mi "trabajo". Me relajé durante 5 ♥♥♥♥ con esta música el tiempo suficiente para darme cuenta de que iba a estar bien.

Después de darme cuenta de eso, apagué el juego y volví a trabajar. Me dolía la mano como el infierno, pero estaba motivado. Dejé de sentir maldita lástima por mí mismo y me convertí en el padre que necesitaba ser en ese momento, no en el chico débil con el que me estaba comportando.

Hoy, soy un amigo cercano de la madre de mis hijos. No peleamos, discutimos ni decimos cosas hirientes entre nosotros. Somos padres y amigos.

Ahora tengo 3 hijos. Mi tercer hijo es, espéralo, TAMBIÉN 4 AÑOS. La mujer con la que estoy estaba pasando por una situación muy similar en el momento de mi propia separación, y nos topamos inesperadamente con la vida del otro. Hemos estado en una relación durante un año y estamos muy felices juntos.

Moraleja de la historia, nunca sabes lo que te depara la vida, y si me hubiera rendido cuando todas las probabilidades estaban en mi contra, no estaría donde estoy hoy. Este pequeño juego tonto me ayudó a darme cuenta de eso.

Gracias
this is not jetpack joyride

it's a cat and mouse game and there are four mice and one cat
you repair generators and escape as the survivors
and the killer tries to kill all of the survivors

game play gets repetitive and new content gets added every 2 months or so, try not to take the game too seriously.

there is a ranking system but it means nothing and does less, which ironically enough makes it rather casual. focus on yourself and try to improve with small goals if you care to do that at all.

the community for the most part is very angry at the time of writing this review and for not many a good reason.

there are a couple of major bugs that are slowly getting fixed.
there are a couple of balance issues that are slowly getting fixed.
there are ways of playing the game that are un-fun on both sides i.e gen rushing and hook camping for survivors and killers respectively.
there has been a flood of cheaters recently.
and the developers are very quiet, probably due to the couple dozen licenses they have keeping their tongues tied.

and anything else the community complains about is usually a one off issue or a non problem.

I recommend people to play this game, mainly if you enjoy asymmetric game play, with horror themed elements.
